result.markdown:
--- title: "Fall 2023 Workshop Survey Responses" author: "Seth Erickson" date: 2024-03-03 editor: visual format: html: df-print: kable --- ## Combined Workshop Survey Responses ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library("tidyverse") # list of workshop IDs to filter results workshops <- c("2023-10-23-ucsb-git", "2023-11-14-ucsb-python") results <- read_csv("data-joined/all_workshops.csv") %>% filter(workshop %in% workshops) ``` ::: ## Departments ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% select(dept_select.pre) %>% separate_rows(dept_select.pre, sep=",") %>% group_by(dept_select.pre) %>% summarise(count=n()) %>% arrange(desc(count)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|dept_select.pre | count| |:---------------------------|-----:| |NA | 7| |Other | 6| |Engineering | 5| |Geography | 5| |Library | 2| |No UCSB Affiliation | 2| |Biology/EEMB/MCDB | 1| |Bren/Environmental Sciences | 1| |Economics | 1| |Probability and Statistics | 1|
::: ::: ### "Other" Departments ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(dept_other.pre) %>% summarise(count=n()) %>% arrange(desc(count)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|dept_other.pre | count| |:--------------|-----:| |NA | 24| |Physics | 3| |Data Science | 1| |Sociology | 1| |physics | 1|
::: ::: ## Occupation ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% select(occupation.pre) %>% separate_rows(occupation.pre, sep=",") %>% group_by(occupation.pre) %>% summarise(count=n()) %>% arrange(desc(count)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|occupation.pre | count| |:------------------------------------|-----:| |Graduate Student | 11| |NA | 7| |Support Staff/Technical Support | 4| |Admin Staff | 3| |Analyst | 2| |Faculty | 2| |Management | 1| |Postdoc Researcher | 1| |Research Staff/Researcher Programmer | 1| |Undergrad Student | 1|
::: ::: ## Motivations ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% select(motivation_select.pre) %>% separate_rows(motivation_select.pre, sep=",") %>% group_by(motivation_select.pre) %>% summarise(count=n()) %>% arrange(desc(count)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|motivation_select.pre | count| |:----------------------------------------------------------|-----:| |To learn new skills | 17| |To learn skills that I can apply to my current work | 17| |To learn skills that I can apply to my work in the future | 13| |To learn skills that will help me get a job or a promotion | 9| |NA | 8| |To refresh or review my skills | 6| |Satisfy requirement for my program or current position | 1|
::: ::: ## Hopes ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, hopes.pre) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |hopes.pre | |:----------------------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Learn to better to manage changes to code for data analysis | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |How Github can help me store my work. | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |I have been using Git but most of it is self-learnt and would love to systematically learn it. | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Branches in GitHub. | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |How to manage and use Git shared amongst many people | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |unsure | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Be a better git/be better at git | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |I want to be able to keep my code private but for my activity to be shown on github so an employer can see how active I am. Bascially, I want to use github as proof of proficiency in programming languages | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |I hope to gain a better understanding of the various platforms used in data analysis. | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |I hope to learn how to use Git for versioning on shared projects, and how to introduce others that join those projects to best practices with Git | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |GitHub | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |I want to be able to write simple code and understand what other people are doing with Python. | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |How to become more comfortable working with programming softwares such as Python and R | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Work with data more efficiently | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |I want to learn basic Python programming skills | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |developing a clean python workflow and a good understanding of the syntax | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |i hope to learn more about data analysis in python, and aboit how i can apply this to my current and future work | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |To recall my python skills | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |get a start on python to do specialized ML applications |
::: ::: ## Applying the material ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_apply.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_apply.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_apply.post | count| |:----------------------|:-------------------------|-----:| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Neither Agree or Disagree | 2| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Strongly Agree | 2| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Strongly Agree | 2| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Strongly Disagree | 1|
::: ::: ## Comfortable in the workshop environment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_comfortable.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_comfortable.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_comfortable.post | count| |:----------------------|:----------------------|-----:| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Strongly Agree | 4| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Somewhat Disagree | 1| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Strongly Agree | 2| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Strongly Disagree | 1|
::: ::: ## Got clear answers ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_clearanswers.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_clearanswers.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_clearanswers.post | count| |:----------------------|:-------------------------|-----:| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Strongly Agree | 4| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Neither Agree or Disagree | 1| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Strongly Agree | 2| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Strongly Disagree | 1|
::: ::: ## Instructors were enthusiastic ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_instr_enthusiasm.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_instr_enthusiasm.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_instr_enthusiasm.post | count| |:----------------------|:---------------------------|-----:| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Somewhat Agree | 2| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Strongly Agree | 3| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Neither Agree or Disagree | 1| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Strongly Agree | 1| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Strongly Disagree | 1|
::: ::: ## Comfortable interacting with instructors ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_instr_interaction.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_instr_interaction.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_instr_interaction.post | count| |:----------------------|:----------------------------|-----:| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Strongly Agree | 4| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Somewhat Disagree | 1| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Strongly Agree | 2| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Strongly Disagree | 1|
::: ::: ## Instructors were knowledgeable ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop, agree_instr_knowledge.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_instr_knowledge.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_instr_knowledge.post | count| |:----------------------|:--------------------------|-----:| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Somewhat Agree | 2| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Strongly Agree | 3| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Somewhat Disagree | 1| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Strongly Agree | 2| |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Strongly Disagree | 1|
::: ::: ## Instructor interaction example ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, instructor_example.post) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |instructor_example.post | |:----------------------|:--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |both the instructors and helpers helped me solve problems on my computer promptly. i really appreciate it! | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |They helped me solving errors that I found and answering questions in general | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Gave many opportunities for questions and requested feedback on topics that should be covered in more depth | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |Seth and Greg answered my questions and it was helpful to see them do the coding in real time | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |They were always willing to help with specific technical issues and made sure we could catch up again | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |instructor and helpers were available to help when I had issues with the codes, access to the site or clarifications about the content |
::: ::: ## Workshop Strengths ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, workshop_strengths.post) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |workshop_strengths.post | |:----------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |the instructions are clear and I am able to get an overview of git, which i could not understand before attending the workshop | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Hands-on, simple, objective. Good descriptive webpages and well-documented step-by-step | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Being in person was very nice for technical help. I like the sticky note system. | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |fairly basic but great for getting a foundational background and intro to Python; well paced; casual and helpful environment; having the Jupyter notebook environment set up for us was great | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |basic intro without necessary prior knowledge, good speed, in principle the technical working environment was set up in a robust way | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |small group to get enough support from instructor and helpers, content, suggested resources/links for future reference |
::: ::: ## Ways to improve the workshop ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, workshop_improved.post) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |workshop_improved.post | |:----------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |I can't think of any right now | |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Some instructors and etxra help were in and out at variable times. Mac vs PC differences | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |The server for of the jupyter notebook environment went down several times and avoiding that would be helpful | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |1)If JupyterLab allows, make all tabs the instructors use available, including the reviews that cover the questions from attendees. 2)Use more days or reduce the content; sometimes it felt that we were going fast and for those with no previous code experience, could be harder. |
::: ::: ## Topic Suggestions ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, suggest_topics.post) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |suggest_topics.post | |:----------------------|:-------------------------------------------------| |2023-10-23-ucsb-git |Using Google Earth Engine through Python and/or R | |2023-11-14-ucsb-python |more Python, R, data visualization |
::: :::
